title: Project setup
description:
STRUCTURE AND CONFIG ONLY â€” DO NOT WRITE ANY APPLICATION CODE. No implementations, no logic, no functions, no routes, no components. This ticket is only: create directories, create/update .gitignore, and at most empty or minimal config files (e.g. package.json with just name and version). If in doubt, do less.

Set up the project from the architecture graph:

1. Inspect the full graph (context.graph_relevant_to_current_ticket or context.graph): for each node use data.label, data.tech, type, and data.description to determine what technologies and components exist.

2. Create a folder structure that matches the graph: one directory (or logical area) per node/component, named by node label or type (e.g. backend/, frontend/, db/ or per-service folders). Structure should reflect how components are connected in the graph.

3. Build a .gitignore from the technologies listed in the graph:
- Python (FastAPI, etc.): __pycache__/, *.pyc, *.pyo, .venv/, venv/, *.egg-info/
- Node/React/JS: node_modules/, dist/, build/, .next/, npm-debug.log*
- Go: vendor/ (if not committed)
- Docker: .env (if secrets), *.log
- General: .env, .env.local, *.log, .DS_Store, IDE folders
Include only the sections relevant to the tech stack present in the graph.

4. Optionally add only empty or near-empty config files if needed (e.g. package.json with {"name": "...", "version": "1.0.0"} and nothing else; or empty __init__.py). Do not add any application code, handlers, components, or logic.
